results.name: Number T(n,k) of ordered set partitions of [n] where k is minimal such that for each block b the smallest integer interval containing b has at most k elements; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..21, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, m, l) option remember; `if`(n=0, m!,
mathematica: b[n_, m_, l_List] := b[n, m, l] = If[n == 0, m!, Sum[b[n - 1, Max[m, j], Append[ReplacePart[l, 1 -> Nothing], If[j <= m, 0, j]]], {j, Append[l, m + 1] ~Complement~ {0}}]]; A[n_, k_] := If[k == 0, If[n == 0, 1, 0], If[k == 1, n!, b[n, 0, Array[0 &, k - 1]]]]; T [n_, k_] := A[n, k] - If[k == 0, 0, A[n, k - 1]]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 04 2017, translated from Maple *)
